Module com.ning.breakout
Package com.ning.breakout.view.graphics

Class CrackedBrick

java.lang.Object
com.ning.breakout.view.graphics.Brick
com.ning.breakout.view.graphics.CrackedBrick
Direct Known Subclasses:
CementBrick, GoldenBrick
public abstract class CrackedBrick extends Brick
CrackedBrick is the abstract class extends from the abstract class Brick. Compares to the Brick, CrackedBrick could make cracks on the brick when the brick is impacted.
Author:
Ning ZHU - modified

  • Constructor Details

    • CrackedBrick

      public CrackedBrick(BrickModel model, int strength, javafx.scene.Group group)
      The Class constructor sets the model and the view container of the cracked brick, binds the layout of the view of the cracked brick with the model, adds the view to the container, and specifies the number of effective impacts the cracked brick can withstand in total by calling the constructor of super class. Additionally, initializes the crack array of the cracked brick with specified length (full strength - 1).
      Parameters:
      model - the model of cracked brick
      strength - the number of effective impacts that the crack brick can withstand in total
      group - the container of cracked brick's view and cracks' view
      See Also:
      • Brick(BrickModel, int, Group)

  • Method Details

    • setImpact

      public boolean setImpact(javafx.geometry.Point2D point, int dir)
      Simulates impact on cracked brick.

      If the cracked brick is broken after impact, the view of the cracked brick and the view of its cracks will be removed from the container, and the score of cracked brick will be set from 0 to the specified score (equals to the full strength) for breaking it.

      Otherwise, if the cracked brick is not broken after impact, a new crack will be created based on the impact point and the impact direction. Then adds the crack into the crack array of the cracked brick, updates the crack count and adds the view of the crack into the container. 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public boolean setImpact(Point2D point, int dir) {
      if(super.isBroken())
          return false;
      super.impact();
      if(!super.isBroken()){
          crack.makeCrack(point,dir);
          updateBrick();
          return false;
      }
      return true;
  }
      Overrides:
      setImpact in class Brick
      Parameters:
      point - the point where the ball impacted the cracked brick
      dir - the impact direction
      Returns:
      the broken status of the cracked brick after impact
      See Also:
      • Brick.setImpact(Point2D, int)

    • repair

      public void repair()
      Repairs the cracked brick.

      Removes the view of all cracks of the cracked brick from the container, empties the crack array and sets the crack count to 0.

      Then, sets the current strength to the initial state (full strength). If the cracked brick is broken, additionally sets the score of the cracked brick to 0, sets the broken status of the cracked brick to false and adds the view of the cracked brick back to the container. (calls the repair() method of super class) 

       
  Modified from the original source code:
  public void repair(){
      super.repair();
      crack.reset();
      brickFace = super.brickFace;
  }
      Overrides:
      repair in class Brick
      See Also:
      • Brick.repair()
